name: mm::page_table::node::entry::Entry::<'a, 'rcu, C>::protect

mm::page_table::PageTableEntryTrait::is_.doc:
Returns if the PTE points to something.

 For PTEs created by [`Self::new_absent`], this method should return
 false. For PTEs created by [`Self::new_page`] or [`Self::new_pt`]
 and modified with [`Self::set_prop`], this method should return true.

mm::page_table::PageTableEntryTrait::pro.doc: Returns the page property of the PTE.

core::cmp::PartialEq::eq.doc: Tests for `self` and `other` values to be equal, and is used by `==`.

mm::page_table::PageTableEntryTrait::set.doc:
Sets the page property of the PTE.

 This methold has an impact only if the PTE is present. If not, this
 method will do nothing.

mm::page_table::node::PageTableGuard::<'.doc:
Writes a page table entry at a given index.

 This operation will leak the old child if the old PTE is present.

 # Safety

 The caller must ensure that:
  1. The index must be within the bound;
  2. The PTE must represent a [`Child`] in the same [`PageTableConfig`]
     and at the right paging level (`self.level() - 1`).
  3. The page table node will have the ownership of the [`Child`]
     after this method.

doc:
Operates on the mapping properties of the entry.

 It only modifies the properties if the entry is present.
